intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, we're here! Welcome to Toha, Crimea's westernmost port city.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's with this place? The people are going about their business. Why aren't they worried about Daein? About the war?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: It's because this area is fairly isolated. Daein's army hasn't come this far, and so life goes on as before. Daein's plan is to seize the capital, then slowly and steadily expand its sphere of influence until it controls everything.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Surely these people have some idea of what's happening.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ignorance is a form of bliss, is it not? These people don't know what it's like to lose a war. They don't want to know. Crimea as a nation has always been blessed by peace. Perhaps this is due to the temperament of its rulers, but the country hasn't seen serious warfare for centuries. While minor skirmishes with the kingdom of Daein have been legion, only the eastern borderlands have taken damage.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: And yet even I know this peace will not last. When we met Daein forces on our scouting mission, they attacked us merely for being within the Crimean border.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Humans are shameless creatures that carelessly ignore any misfortune which does not befall them directly. They can--and often do--turn a blind eye to all manner of wickedness so long as it does not touch them or their kin. They will bow their heads, condemning those victims for bringing calamity upon themselves, and then they will cast their eyes toward heaven in thanks while their neighbors lay dying around them.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: But the war is happening here. This is their home, not someone else's.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: When the Daein army darkens their doorsteps, perhaps they will understand. When the peace they take for granted is shattered, and their sons and daughters slaughtered in the streets...Perhaps then will they comprehend the misfortunes they so long pretended not to see. I have no sympathy for them.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: My goodness, the nastier the truth, the blunter he gets...Quite a delightful staff officer you have there.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: He, um...he has an undeniable streak of severity in him but...but this? Something's bothering him, that's for sure.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: It's to be expected. Even I'm a bit shocked by this place. Can they truly be as placid as they appear? Soren's a very empathetic young man. The emotions of this place may have proven to be too much for him.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ignoring impending doom because you cannot prevent it...Fatalism is by nature a disheartening beast. Well, for all those born with nothing, there are those born with everything. Perhaps those who never notice the difference are the ones we should envy.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's that supposed to mean?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Huh? Oh, I was talking to myself. Pay me no mind.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Now then, I've got to see a man about a ship. While I'm gone, why don't you get your supplies squared away? I'm sure that the journey ahead will require a lot of packing.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ranulf, I'll go with you.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No, no, that's all right. You should supervise the supply acquisition. You're going to be at sea for months, you know?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I know that, but...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it, Titania?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: She's worried about me. She doesn't want to leave a solitary laguz wandering around a beorc city.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: But I thought Crimea and Gallia were allied nations. Why would a wandering laguz be cause for concern?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, it shouldn't be, but...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Do you remember what King Caineghis told you? The friendship between Crimea and Gallia exists only between the ruling classes. It hasn't taken root in the minds of the common citizenry at all.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: That being said, things have improved quite a bit since King Ramon ascended to the throne The reports of hunts and such other horrors have all but disappeared...Oh, don't worry! I'll be fine! I've got connections, see? It's not like I'll be roaming the docks begging for passage.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right then, the job is yours. lease be careful.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You, too. Don't mess anything up!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We should be leaving, but...Looks like everyone's going to be a while, yet.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike are you ready to go?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Me? As long as I've got my sword, I'm always ready.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: A sword? That's it?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: If I've got my cape, I can sleep just about anywhere. And as for food, well...Something always turns up.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Hee hee! That's delightful.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It is?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes, very much so. Tee hee hee!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Princesses...I don't think I'll ever understand them.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's going on? Why all the excitement?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike! There's a crowd gathering at the town entrance...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's--

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Attention citizens! We've received reports of Crimean army stragglers hiding in this town! From this point forth, the Daein army will blockade all points of entry! No one comes or goes without our leave! The harbor is also closed! No ships will be allowed to sail!!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike...Daein troops have--

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I know. All we can do is move toward the docks and try not to be discovered.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Have you seen Ranulf?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Not yet.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Wait, here he comes now. Ranulf! Over here.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Hoo! Things sure are heating up, aren't they?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How are things on your end?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Everything's set. All you need to do is sneak down to the harbor. You'll be met there by a man with a dusky pallor. His name is Nasir. Nasir is a man you can trust. I've explained your situation to him, and he's willing to help. If you can reach his ship safely, he'll take care of everything and deliver you to Begnion.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf, aren't you coming, too?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I was planning on it, but...Daein's movements have me concerned. I'll stay behind and see what's going on.

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Oh, I'm sorry! I wasn't watching where I was going...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No, pardon me--

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Ah! Eeeeeeek! Su-sub-human!!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Blast!

intro.speaker: Youth
intro.line: I-it's true! A sub-human! How dare you come prowling around here!

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: Beast! Ya stinking sub-humans need to learn yer place! Human towns are too good for ya!

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: Eww! It's so hairy! Go on! Scat!

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Get out of here! Monster!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Dang!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mordecai!

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Ike! We must leave!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? No! We have to help Ranulf...

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: All of this noise will attract the attention of the Daein troops.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's why we have to hurry up and help--

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: He'll be fine! Leave him.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Ranulf is strong. Even stronger than me. It's all right.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf has no intention of defending himself! Look, he's not even changing forms! I can't just stand by and watch as he gets murdered!

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Ike! Wait!

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: ...Idiot human...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Stop! Get out of my way! Keep your hands off him!

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: Who do ya think ya are? Why would a human want to protect some sub-human?

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: He's a friend to this monster! I saw them talking earlier!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's that to you?

intro.speaker: Youth
intro.line: Hey. the Crimean royals had sub-human companions, didn't they? Maybe you're one of those army guys the Daein troops are searching for!

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: You there! Daein soldier! Ho! There are some suspicious folk over here!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Huh? That way! Hurry!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you mad?! Your king was murdered by Daein! And now you're going to cooperate with them?

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: Well, um...

intro.speaker: Youth
intro.line: I heard the king was teamin' up with those sub-humans! That's what got him killed!

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: Yeah! That's right! If we need allies, I'll take flesh-and-blood Daein humans over some fanged sub-human freak!

intro.speaker: Youth
intro.line: Yeah! Yeah! At least we know what we're getting! Trust your own kind!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You people are insane!

intro.speaker: Vigilante
intro.line: Where's the sub-human everyone's screaming about?

intro.speaker: Grandfather
intro.line: Huzzah! The Toha vigilantes are here! Grab those guys and turn them over to the Daein army! That will prove our allegiance and gain our village favor!

intro.speaker: Vigilante
intro.line: Har har! If you want sub-humans hunted down, I'm your man!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf! Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Why did you come back?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Because some fool was going to lay here and get beaten to death instead of defending himself!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ah, Ike. What would you have me do? Gallia and Crimea have formed an alliance. I cannot jeopardize that by harming these people, no matter what ill they may bear me.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Even if none of them care two figs for their own country?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Even if. They're citizens of Crimea, after all.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, I'm not Gallian, so there's no reason for me to hold anything back!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ike! Listen to me! They think that you and I are allies! If you attack, it's no different than if I do so myself! So...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Let me guess...you're telling me to avoid the Daein pursuit, leave the town vigilantes alone, get to the docks as soon as possible, find a man named Nasir and get everyone on his boat. Is that it?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Exactly! I don't care what anyone else says, I think you're pretty bright!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, I'll play along. But mark my words, if they attack, heads will roll!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: What? Hey! That's not going to do us any good!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania! Soren! Get everyone together! We're getting out of here!

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Listen to me! Do not let a single Crimean soldier escape our grasp. Sweep the entire town! Arrest anyone suspicious!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: General Mackoya! Sir, there's a group of vigilantes who want to help us. What shall I tell them?

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Hmm...Very well. Let them do as they please.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Pardon me, are you the commander of these forces?

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: I am. And who are you?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: I'm captain of the boat you see moored here. My name is Nasir. I stopped by to accomplish some brief piece of business, but...Your soldiers are now preventing me from setting sail. I need to leave this place.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: I apologize for the inconvenience. However, we are trying to stop some Crimean soldiers from escaping. To that end we need the cooperation of all citizens...ship captains included.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: My ship is a simple merchant vessel, sailing under the flag of the Begnion Empire. If I present such documentation, surely it will prove I have no ties whatsoever with Crimea.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Under Daein rule, such...Begnion papers are nothing more than fishwrap.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Yet--

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: You called yourself, Nasir, correct? Protest too loudly, Nasir, and we may think you a Crimean sympathizer. If that were to happen, who knows what...unfortunate fate might your simple merchant ship...

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: ...I see. So be it.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: You there! Soldier!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Sir?

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Strengthen the watch on this ship. That man is up to something...I can feel it...No matter what happens, that ship must not be allowed to set sail. Burn her and sink her first!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Now then, where is our special guest?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: I'm right here, General Mackoya.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Oh! Sir Black Knight! I hope I didn't keep you waiting.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: No, I just arrived. Let us proceed...I would hear your report.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: There are no problems whatsoever. I've nothing to report, save the tedium of it all. The farther west we travel, the weaker the Crimean fighting spirit becomes. Each town displays less and less resistance--now they literally throw wide the gates at first sign of our approach! With duty as humdrum as this, I worry that my troops may become sloppy and lose their edge.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: As a fellow warrior, I can sympathize with your plight.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: I thank you for your understanding.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: This town was not scheduled for subjugation until much later...Tell me, why are you here now?

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Yes, as to that...Mere days ago, a castle that held Crimean prisoners of war was attacked and the captives freed. The perpetrators were Crimean soldiers accompanied by sub-humans. According to our intelligence reports, their trail led here...

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: The princess of Crimea is said to have fled to Gallia. If we can capture this band, we may gain information on her location.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Do you require my assistance?

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: I thank you for the generous offer. However, if you were to enter the fray, it would be over in a twinkling. My men are starved for combat. I would beg your restraint so that they may be allowed some...entertainment.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: As you will. The field is yours. Turn your soldiers loose, and may their blades run red with glory.

intro.speaker: Mackoya
intro.line: Your graciousness is greatly appreciated.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Good luck, Ike! You'll be fine. As for me...I think I'll play a little game of cat and mouse with these Daein fools.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: The Gallian sub-human! After him! Don't let him get away!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Everyone, move out for the harbor! Try to avoid conflict with the local vigilante group if you can. Let's go!

intro.speaker: Zihark
intro.line: Hey! Are there really sub-humans about?

intro.speaker: Vigilante
intro.line: Oh yeah, no mistake about it. And they'll as soon kill you as look at you!

intro.speaker: Zihark
intro.line: Where are they?

intro.speaker: Vigilante
intro.line: They're over there...Cunning beast! We're just about to start flushing them out of hiding.

intro.speaker: Zihark
intro.line: I see. If you find one, be sure to give me a call.

intro.speaker: Vigilante
intro.line: Har har! I like that guy. He came to our little town just for the chance to hunt sub-humans!

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Ah!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Grrr! Flee. You're Crimean...I cannot fight you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Hold on! Please!...I am not an enemy to laguz.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: L-laguz...? How do you--

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I joined this vigilante group because I knew it would afford me a chance to help you flee. Listen, I'll distract the townspeople. While they're worried about me you can make good your escape.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I cannot trust the word of a human.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: ...I see. Well, if I cut down these vigilantes, will you believe me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Huh?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: One? Two? All of them? How many do you want? Just give the word and I'll start the cutting!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Hsss! Quiet! Why? Why would you...

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I want to help you....That's all.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: ...I see... You're not an enemy. That much I'll believe...

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Thank you. Now, you must hurry away from this place.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: No, I cannot flee. I have fr-friends with whom I must board a ship.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Will you not desist? It's much too dangerous. The vigilantes and Daeins want nothing  more than to kill laguz!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I'm not leaving.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I see...If that's your stance, then I've no choice.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Hm?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I will join your group.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Don't...Don't be ridiculous!

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: What's your name?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I am Lethe, but--

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: That's a good name.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: That's beside the point! You--

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I am Zihark. Well met, Lethe! Whoops! I don't think we have time for formal introductions. Let's hurry!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: H-hold it! I have not agreed to this!

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Ah!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: You are a vigilante. We must avoid vigilantes. You should flee.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: You would speak so to the vigilante group that's hunting you? You're a kind laguz, aren't you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Hm? My words are not good. You must go quickly.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: No, you are the one who should flee. Leave the rest to me. I'll confuse the townsfolk and give you time to run.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: What? Why?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I don't want to see any laguz harmed, so I joined these vigilantes as a double agent.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Hmm...? I am confused. But...you do not smell like an enemy. Our group must get on that ship. We are taking it to Begnion.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: Will you not desist? It's much too dangerous. The vigilantes and the Daeins desire nothing more than to kill laguz!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Even so, we will go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I see...If that's your stance, then I've no choice.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I will join your group.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: You will betray your friends?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I told you, they're not my friends. I am an ally to the laguz. What? You need proof? There!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Why do you drop your blade? That bright metal tool is your only fang.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I want you to believe me....Please. You must believe me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: ...I believe you. I am Mordecai, warrior of Gallia. Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zihark
recruit-talk.line: I am Zihark. Well met, Mordecai! Whoops! I don't think we have time for formal introductions. Let's hurry!

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: Commander Haar! Awake! This is no time to be sleeping! A sub-human has been spotted! Come, let us join in the thrill of the hunt!

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Yaaaawn...Mmm...let's not. Even if we don't lift a finger, Mackoya's pups will take care of everything.

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: Battle glory awaits! Would you allow others to steal this chance from beneath your very nose?

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Yawn. Go entertain yourself, will you? Fight a soldier or lance a peasant or...what you will. But for the love of flying, stop interrupting my sleep!

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: The fighting? Um...Wake me when it's done. Yaaaaawwnn...Zzzzzzz...

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: That's it!! I'm going by myself!

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: Zzzzzz...Snort! Wha--? Jill, hold a moment.

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: Yes? Have you changed your mind?

battle.speaker: Haar
battle.line: You'll wait here with the rest of us. We don't move unless we're attacked. That's the word from the top.

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: All these men, and they're still having problems? Did I make a miscalculation?

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: We meet again, son of Greil.

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: Why do you challenge me? You are not worthy of being my foe. Flee while you are able.

boss.speaker: Mackoya
boss.line: Hmm...They're not fleeing...They're actually headed this way. It appears that we have underestimated the courage of our foe.

boss.speaker: Mackoya
boss.line: So we were the ones guilty of miscalculation...How shameful...Your Excellency...The rest is...up to you......

recruit-battle.speaker: Zihark
recruit-battle.line: I bear you no ill will, but I must...There are reasons I must fight.

recruit-battle.speaker: Jill
recruit-battle.line: Father, please lend me your protection in this, my first battle!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: What's that? Thieves are taking advantage of the commotion to sack our little town? We must close the front gate! Thanks for your help! Oh, I almost forgot! Please. take this as a token of thanks. Go on, take it!

visit.speaker: Lady
visit.line: Say, aren't you...You are! You're one of those Crimeans that the Daein soldiers are after, aren't you?...Go on, get moving. I'll pretend I didn't see anything. Don't worry, just go!  Wait a second..Here. Take this with you.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Yaaaaaaah! S-stay back! Sub-human beast! Aaaaiiieeeeee!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Ohmygosh...are you...Are you really fighting Daein? Ooo...that's so brave! We've heard so many rumors about Crimea's defeat...That's why everyone in town acts like they do. No one has the courage to stand up to these fierce Daein forces. Everyone believes that if they just cooperate, life here will go on as it always has. Please, take this magic scroll. It was my brother's...He was murdered by the Daein army. Fight for him, too.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: H-h-heavens! Please don't kill me! I'll give you whatever you want...Here, have some yarn! Uh... Dried fish?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: ...The mercenaries boarded the ship safely. Now, how to proceed...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: You're not impeding that ship. I won't allow it.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: One of Gallia's beast warriors...I've met you once before. Yes...at the castle near the sea of trees.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: From where I'm standing, we've actually met twice.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Oh?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I saw you that night...Standing in the light of the full moon. The night you murdered Sir Greil.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Ha ha! So you were the one traveling with the beast king, eh? Interesting. By measuring his aide's strength, I will naturally learn more of the king's true power.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Hate to tell you this, but my king is not to be measured against the likes of me. He is far beyond that.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: All the better. Now then, let us begin.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: ...Ugh...why? Why do my attacks do nothing?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: You fight impressively. However, you are no match for me.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Huh?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Rise. Leave this to me.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: You...you were one of the prisoners...

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: This knight will not raise his hand to me....Correct?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Go now, quickly!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: If you insist! I'll give proper thanks when next we meet.

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: Commander Haar! Let us pursue the enemy ship! They're friends of the sub-humans! We cannot allow them to escape!

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Uwaaaaaahhh...That was a good nap. Well, looks like the fighting's over. Form up.It's time to withdraw.

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Listen to me, Jill. We're scheduled to return home tomorrow. If you were injured in a place like this, your lord father would not be pleased.

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: It's because of my father that I must not return home empty-handed. I must have something to show him! Please--

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Simmer down, girl. The Black Knight has ordered us to withdraw. Would you ignore his word?

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: Th-that...

end.speaker: Haar
end.line: Would be suicide. Correct. So let's move out!

end.speaker: Jill
end.line: Blast.

end.speaker: Mackoya
end.line: M-my lord Black Knight! A ship is departing! If we ready our own ship and set sail without delay, we can overtake it immediately!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Listen to me, Daein general. You will withdraw from this place. I will not allow you to pursue that ship.

end.speaker: Mackoya
end.line: Who are you to speak to me so? Do you have any idea who I am?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Gather your men....Withdraw.

end.speaker: Mackoya
end.line: Yet we--

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: I will not repeat myself. Do it now.

end.speaker: Mackoya
end.line: Yes...yes, at once!

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: Are you sure that's true?

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Yes! You can ask these two for more details.

end.speaker: Mister
end.line: The two of us, we're here representing the townsfolk.

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: You say that a green-haired lass boarded that ship?

end.speaker: Youth
end.line: Y-yes! She had a very noble bearing about her...And she was beautiful.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Her name was...Ellie? Ellen? They called her something like that.

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: It's true! Princess Elincia...Ha ha!  My luck has changed.

end.speaker: Youth
end.line: All of us, all the townsfolk, are ready to cooperate in any way we can! If you would keep that in mind...Um...

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: Believe me, I understand your...loyalty.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Well then...

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: You there! Come here!

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Yes, sir! Right here.

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: Get these two worms out of here. Find the hardest physical labor in this town and get these fools started. Work 'em from dusk to dawn without stopping. Work 'em until they can no longer move! You got that!

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Yes, sir! Understood, sir!

end.speaker: Youth
end.line: B-but, that's...

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Why? Why would you...

end.speaker: Norris
end.line: Stop your whining. How else am I to reward worms vile enough to sell their own princess to the enemy? Enjoy your payment, you greedy dastards! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

end.speaker: Youth
end.line: Our own...princess? That's not...It can't be. It can't!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: No...Nooooooo!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike! How wonderful! I didn't think you were going to make it...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'm sorry to have worried you.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh, no, I'm just happy to see you well. So very...happy.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Brother, you stupid fool! Fighting a knight as strong as that...You idiot! I was...so scared...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'm sorry, Mist.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Who cares...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You really were frightened...I'm sorry, I truly am.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: ...All right...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Huff...huff...Whew! I doubt the enemy will pursue me this far.

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: A warrior such as you, wounded? Did a beorc give you that bruise?[

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Master Giffca! Owwwww!

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: The king told me to come and check on you. Don't move...Hm, you're plenty banged up, but nothing appears to be broken.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: There's one among the Daein army whose power is overwhelming. To move with such speed with all that armor...I tell you, it's not right! And now, the king's forced to use you, his shadow warrior, to check up on me...Our ministers are as obstinate as ever. No matter what happens, they will not approve of an alliance with the beorc.

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: Nothing to be done about that. Every one of the older retainers has memories of laguz subordination. Even the king. If Princess Elincia were not King Ramon's orphan, I doubt he would be willing to aid her.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Perhaps you're right...At any rate, the princess and the others are now safely at sea.

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: And the watchdog? No signs of carelessness, I presume.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Of course not.Even the elders will bend their ears to hear what that one says--that one is special, after all.

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: And how do you see this? Princess Elincia's drive for the reconstruction of Crimea. Does she have a chance?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Eh, who can say? Which way the wheel turns depends on Ike and his mercenaries. Success and failure are but a hair removed.

end.speaker: Giffca
end.line: So this company, which has done nothing but flee, controls the fate of the kingdom? That's a dangerous gamble, isn't it?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: All gambles are dangerous, Master Giffca. But no mistake about it, Daein's next target is Gallia. We must go home and prepare!

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: ...Princess Crimea, ]did she board the ship to Begnion with the remainder of Gawain's mercenaries?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: The hindrance that was Gawain is dead. The location of the medallion...will soon be known. Has our worm worked itself into the group?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: It appears that our worm has been accepted as a trusted member of the company.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Heh heh heh. All is going as planned. Now, we let them swim as they please.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: ...There is one thing. I met someone unexpected at the harbor.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Who?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: The prime minister of the Begnion Empire...

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: What?!...Is that true? If he is nosing about, we must not make any mistakes. Did he give any indication he had caught on to our plans?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: That...I do not know. He did tell me to deliver a message to you...Overreaching ambition invites disaster.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: Pah. Nonsense. Our only concern is the princess of Crimea and the medallion. We must wait and watch until such time as we can strike.

end.speaker: Ashnard
end.line: In the interim, I want you to take charge of the invasion of Gallia. Be smart. You must not allow Gallia to bring their full might to bear. Understood?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: ...As you will.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Hey there, traveler! Do you have everything you need? If you stop by my humble shop, you'll find the best deals in town! Whattya say? Interested?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, that sounds great. Listen, can I ask you a question?

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: No problem! You can ask me anything.Especially if it's about my low, low prices!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What do the townspeople think of Daein? You knew that they were coming. Didn't anyone think to flee Crimea?

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Flee? Don't be absurd!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But Crimea lost the war.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Yeah, I know. And honestly? That doesn't really affect us common folk, ya know? The truth is, we don't care who sitson the throne. To us, they're all just faceless beings who rule from on high. If they tried to raise taxes or something, you better believe we'd protest, but otherwise...

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: I mean, take the king of Daein. He's just another man, right? If we keep working, he can keep living the high life. So it's not like he's going to treat us poorly or anything. As long as we can live our lives and have a little happiness, we aren't going to worry about it all too much.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Oh, but if we were invaded by Gallia, well, that's a different story altogether. If our country were overrun by those savage beasts, who knows what could happen? Now THAT scares me!

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: What the? Hey! Wait! Come back! What about my low, low prices?! Now what was that all about?

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: Pardon me, buddy. I haven't seen you around town before. You a traveling mercenary?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yes, I suppose you could say that.

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: Nice sword...You look like a man who knows his business. If you're looking for work, I've a proposition for you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A proposition?

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: I run a vigilante group that helps keep our fair town safe. A strong man like you would be most welcome.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Thanks, but I've got something lined up.

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: Oh, really? That's too bad. Heading out to sea?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Maybe.

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: Har har! Cautious to the end! I like that! Well, just in case you are...I want you to have this.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hm? What's this?

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: It's a special sword. It'll come in handy if you ever...find yourself at sea. Not that you would! Har har!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Really? You're giving me a sword? Are you sure?

conversation.speaker: Vigilante
conversation.line: Well, there is one condition...Once you've finished your job, you come back and see me. I'd like you to reconsider that vigilante position.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Understood. Thanks again for the blade.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Princess!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: My lord Ike...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Why are you here all by yourself? That's not very safe.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: I was looking at the town. I'm unfamiliar with the world outside the imperial villa where I was raised. This is the first time I've been able to see how other people live. Everything is so new and different to my eyes. This...is a town, isn't it? There's so much energy, and everyone seems to be enjoying themselves.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: With all the boats coming in and out of the harbor, this town's livelier than most. That's for sure.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: It's like nothing has happened. All the death and destruction we've seen feels like horrible dream...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Mmm...

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Haa! Yaaa! Hiiii-yaaaa!!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What are you doing?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: I'm trying to regain the superb physique I lost when I was being held prisoner.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Are you ready to board the ship?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: I was born ready! Hoooo-ha! I don't need anything! Even as we speak, many of my fellow Crimeans are suffering at the hands of Daein. If I cannot rush to their aid today, then I can at least prepare myself for the day when I can.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I see. Well, when we're ready, I'll let you know.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Understood.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Sorry to have interrupted you.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: My lord Ike!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: You rescued and cared for Princes Elincia. You have my heartfelt thanks. She...For us, she is our one solitary hope.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Right, enough talking.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Until we make our triumphant return to Melior, all I can do is keep training! Haaa! Nyaaa! Whaaaaaaaaaaa!!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Careful! Don't pull anything...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What are you looking at?

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Oh, just this. It's sort of a good-luck charm. My family gave it to me when I left home. We never had much money, so my parents gathered some stones from our farm back home and put them in this leather pouch. It's not much to look at, but it means a lot to me Every day, I take them out and talk to them like they're my family. How is everyone? I'm out here doing the best I can. Don't worry. I'll be home soon. Just stuff like that. I know it sounds foolish, but if I don't do this...I won't...I won't have the courage to fight.

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Don't worry about my feelings. You can laugh. Acting like this at my age, what a silly man I am!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's not silly, Brom. You're a strong man who has decided to fight for the sake of his family. I know that your family is very proud of you.

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: ...Sniff...S-s-sniff...Mm. Thank you, Ike. Sniff... Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Well, that's that.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Are you ready to go, Nephenee?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Ah! Ike...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: ...Um...Nope! Nothin'! I'm fine.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Are you sure?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Yeah! Sure I'm sure!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You know, it's hard being a prisoner. It's physically and mentally demanding...I need to know: can you fight?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Not a problem

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's easy for you to say, but you sound like you're about to fall over.

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: That? Aw, no! That's a habit...It's just the way I talk. Just talkin'!...Sorry.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: No need to apologize. As long as you're not feeling ill, everything's fine. All right, I'll see you later.

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Right then...
